plan: To begin with, I'll place an aggressive bid close to my value for A, let's say 85, to increase my chances of winning. If successful, I'll closely observe the winning bids for B, Bidder Betty and Bidder Charles. For next rounds, I'll start to vary my strategy by lowering my bid for A progressively to save money and see how others adapt. I will also start to increase my bets for B slightly, to gather data on my opponent's values and strategies. This iterative approach will help optimize my strategy for maximum profit.

For this round, I will begin with a conservative strategy, where I'll bid low on Good A, say $2. This is because my value towards it is relatively low (5). Then, depending on whether I win or lose Good A, I would adjust my bid on Good B after gauging the bidding behavior of Andy and Charles. This way, I can preserve capital for the good I value more (Good B, valued at 97), while overlapping with potential learning benefits from observing the bidding pattern for Good A. Post this round, I will adapt further strategies based on the outcomes.
